semantic_title: Reporting Same Diagnosis Code Only Once Per Encounter
section_path: Section I > B. General Coding Guidelines > 12. Reporting Same Diagnosis Code More than Once

content.full_text: Each unique ICD-10-CM diagnosis code may be reported only once for an encounter. This applies to bilateral conditions when there are no distinct codes identifying laterality or two different conditions classified to the same ICD-10-CM diagnosis code. (Evidence: pg no: 15, L76-L78)
content.summary: Prohibits reporting the same ICD-10-CM diagnosis code more than once per encounter, including for bilateral conditions without distinct laterality codes and different conditions with the same code. (Evidence: pg no: 15, L76-L78)
key_concepts: Each unique code reported only once per encounter (Evidence: pg no: 15, L76-L77)
Applies to bilateral conditions without distinct laterality codes (Evidence: pg no: 15, L77-L78)
Applies to different conditions with same ICD-10-CM code (Evidence: pg no: 15, L78)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Report each unique ICD-10-CM diagnosis code only once per encounter (Evidence: pg no: 15, L76-L77)
detailed_rules.explanation: No matter how many times a condition occurs or is documented during an encounter, each unique ICD-10-CM diagnosis code should be reported only once for that encounter (Evidence: pg no: 15, L76-L77)
common_applications: Multiple episodes of same condition during stay
Different conditions mapping to same code

detailed_rules.rule_text: Rule applies to bilateral conditions without distinct laterality codes (Evidence: pg no: 15, L77-L78)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a patient has bilateral conditions but there are no distinct codes that identify laterality (left, right, bilateral), the same code should be reported only once even though the condition affects both sides (Evidence: pg no: 15, L77-L78)
common_applications: Bilateral joint conditions with same code
Bilateral skin conditions with same code

detailed_rules.rule_text: Rule applies to different conditions classified to same code (Evidence: pg no: 15, L78)
detailed_rules.explanation: When two different conditions are classified to the same ICD-10-CM diagnosis code, that code should be reported only once per encounter regardless of the fact that they are different conditions (Evidence: pg no: 15, L78)
common_applications: Different types of pneumonia with same code
Different fracture types with same code

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify all conditions to be coded for the encounter
Step 3: Review code list for duplicates
Step 4: Remove duplicate codes, keeping only one instance of each
Step 5: Verify no unique code appears more than once
